fullDescription.text:
In the function `withdrawLeftOver()` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to msg.sender.

There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `sendToWinner()`.
The return value of an external call is not checked. Note that execution continue even if the called contract throws.
A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function sendToWinner(). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location

Lotto.withdrawLeftOver (/data/demo_analysis/source_code/lotto.sol#24-28) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- msg.sender.send(this.balance) (/data/demo_analysis/source_code/lotto.sol#27)

Lotto.winner (/data/demo_analysis/source_code/lotto.sol#12) is never initialized. It is used in:
	- sendToWinner (/data/demo_analysis/source_code/lotto.sol#17-22)

27.fullDescription:
In the function `withdrawLeftOver()` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to msg.sender.

There is a check on storage index 0. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `sendToWinner()`.
27.name: AccessControlVulnerability

27.fullDescription: The return value of an external call is not checked. Note that execution continue even if the called contract throws.
27.name: UncheckedLowCallsVulnerability
